portada.text: A place where past, <slow>present</slow>, and future intertwine in shadows and whispers. Every door hides a <shake force=1>secret</shake>, every choice seals a fate. Will you uncover the <fade>truth</fade>, or become part of the mystery?

inicio.text:
You wake up in an unfamiliar room. The only thing you remember is checking into a hotel. The red velvet carpet, the heavy curtains blocking the light, and the faint scent of dampness feel foreign. On the nightstand, a sealed letter bearing your name waits.

Upon opening it, you recognize the handwriting instantly: yours, but older, <slow>steadier.</slow>

'If you're reading this, then it's already <shake force=1>too late.</shake> Trust no one. Do not believe what they tell you. Remember that every choice has a price.'

The signature at the bottom sends a chill down your spine:<slow speed=300> </slow>'<glitch>You, Scarlet.</glitch>'

1A.text:
The fogged-up mirror reveals a young girl, around 8 years old, with facial features eerily similar to yours. She is writing: <fade>'Why did you abandon me?'</fade>

The bathtub overflows with black water.

1B.text: Portraits of you at different ages line the hallway walls. At the far end, a woman identical to you is carrying a suitcase toward the elevator. Meanwhile, the door to room 87 is slightly ajar.

2A.text:
You feel something cold around your neck.

The water evaporates, leaving behind a silver necklace engraved with the initials <slow>S.S.</slow> and the date 18/03/2010.<slow speed=400> </slow>Your accident.

A floating diary drifts open to an entry that reads: 'I did something terrible. <glitch>No one knows</glitch>.'

2B.text:
Blood trickles from your hand; the g<glitch>i</glitch>r<glitch>l</glitch> in the mirror smiles.

She hands you a faceless doll and whispers: <fade>'Mom locked me in here.</fade><slow speed=500> </slow><fade>Why don't you love me?'</fade>

2C.text: You catch the woman in the elevator. Her suitcases are filled with *childhood photos of <glitch>you</glitch>.* She presses a button labeled Ψ and mutters: 'This hotel exists because <shake force=1>you</shake> allow it.'

options.text: Push her aside and take her place.

2D.text:
A projector plays footage of *<glitch>you</glitch>* signing a contract, tears streaming down your face. The text on the screen reads:

<fade>'I trade one memory for one year of life.'</fade>

3A.text: The diary's ashes form a map of the hotel. An 'X' marks room 830. The walls whisper: 'The <glitch>truth</glitch> burns more than fire.'

3B.text: The girl leads you to a withered garden where a tree is covered in *photographs of you in <fade>alternate</fade> lives.* In every one, you are <glitch>dead</glitch>, <fade>missing</fade>, or <slow>trapped.</slow>

3C.text: The elevator plummets for hours. As you fall, the walls reveal your father crying beside an empty grave. The woman repeats: 'It was <glitch>your</glitch> fault.'

3D.text:
Beneath the floor, you find <fade>*87 contracts*</fade>, all signed by you. The oldest one dates back to 1998—the year you were born.

The hotel manager is... *your future <glitch>self</glitch>*.

options.text: Use the key from room 304 on the chest.

4A.text: The girl dissolves into fireflies. A door appears with a sign reading <fade>'Exit.'</fade> As you step through, your heart stops for a few seconds.

4B.text: Inside the chest, you find a VHS tape labeled: '<glitch>Accident</glitch> 18/03/2010.' Upon watching it, you realize <slow>*you weren’t responsible*.</slow>

F-loop.text:
Every time you try to leave, you wake up in room 304. Each time, your <fade>reflection</fade> grows blurrier, your memories hazier.

In the real world, your family receives an annual letter: <slow>'I'm sorry.'</slow>

F-otherSelf.text:
You escape, but now live the life of an alternate version of yourself. Yet in every <slow speed=50>mirror,</slow> you see the woman from the elevator.

One day, the phone rings. You answer: 'Yes, <glitch>Manager</glitch>. I'm ready.'

F-debtPaid.text:
Your body fades into the hotel as the girl regains her <glitch>face</glitch>.

In the real world, everyone forgets you ever existed.

F-reflectionAccepted.text: You return to <glitch>reality</glitch>, but something is wrong. You're <instant>no</instant> longer in control of your body. The girl now lives your life, while you are merely a <glitch>spec</glitch>tat<glitch>or</glitch>.

F-atWhatCost.text:
You escape, but feel no love, no fear, no guilt.

Your family and friends slowly drift away. At night, you hum songs with the <glitch>girl</glitch>.

F-warningIgnored.text:
Each time you look in the <fade>mirror</fade>, your reflection lags behind. Over the years, the delay <slow>grows.</slow>

The last time you were seen, you were sitting in front of a <glitch>mirror</glitch>… waiting for your reflection to blink first.

F-truthRevealed.text:
You discover that the hotel is your creation. Now, you must manage it, tempting past versions of yourself.
The girl is your first <glitch>victim</glitch>.
